content: QuoteAccording to the official announcement shared by the team of Gluwa DeFi ecosystem, it has called the Federal Government of Nigeria to participate in the progress of a national crypto regulation framework. Adequate regulation is of paramount importance to unleash the potential of blockchain in Africa's largest economyQuoteGluwa CEO Tae Oh is excited by the prospects of the collaboration with the Nigerian government in terms of the sucess of crypto in the African region in the long run: We believe that cryptocurrencies have the potential to transform the financial landscape in Nigeria and across the African continent By working closely with the Nigerian government, we hope to create a policy framework that encourages the responsible use of cryptocurrencies while also protecting consumers and preventing criminal activities.QuoteAhmed Gloria Kufeji, a director at the Nigerian Ministry of Finance, says that he is impressed by the mission and vision of Gluwa and the role it can play in blockchain progress in Nigeria: We are pleased to see interest from companies like Gluwa in supporting the growth and development of the blockchain industry in Nigeria. We recognize the potential of blockchain technology to drive economic growth and financial inclusion, and we are committed to creating a policy framework that encourages innovation and investment while also protecting consumers and preventing criminal activities.SourceConcerning cryptocurrency for we country, we all kno de position wey our government stand for d mata, but d tori wey I carry come be say, Gluwa, a blockchain company dey propose collaboration with Nigerian government and dem dey talk how dem fit take join bodi regulate cryptocurrency for we country.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Only what I think is that Gluwa needs popularity in Nigeria and using the privilege of regulation to penetrate. If the government still work in hands with what is pertaining to Nigeria with a foreign organization, shame on them. This should be the work of Nigerian SEC and other Nigerian regulators in relation to cryptocurrencies.Quote from: sokani on April 21, 2023, 07:00:17 PMConcerning cryptocurrency for we country, we all kno de position wey our government stand for d mataOur government has never interfered with bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies adoption in the country, all that happened was the work of the CBN.

Wetting make them no reason better exchanges like Binance mean say them no get time and intention to legalize Bitcoin soon, we just they hope say if the new government come, things go better small.
